title: ADDIE Model-Based Instructional Design for Enhancing Health Equity and Inclusion in Medical Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic healthcare systems and leadership experience as a manager
context.additional_context: Post-COVID-19 exacerbation of healthcare equity issues for vulnerable patient groups, highlighting the need for inclusive education for corporate managers/leaders.

learning_goals: Learners can define the concepts of health equity and inclusivity and explain at least three application examples in healthcare settings.
Learners can design educational programs by applying the Health Equity Framework (HEI) at each stage of the ADDIE model.
Learners can propose at least two inclusive educational strategies (e.g., accessibility improvements, bias reduction) that consider learner diversity.
Learners can establish evaluation criteria for trauma-informed safety programs through real-world case analysis.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
